title: 'RICH' uppercase serif
content:
Anyone know this one? Should be obvious but can't find a match. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925061801im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-06-12%20at%2012_4430.24.51.png)
author: thedash

comments.content:
Very similar to [  
PerpetuaRomanMT ](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925061801/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/perpetua/) designed by Eric Gill in the 1930s.  
But there differences in the serifs and the beak on C. Compare your image with:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925061801im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PerpetuaRomanMT_5597.jpg)
  
So I wonder what font is closer?  
Don

Thanks Don.  
The metrics seems to be very close. However, the serifs on my version is definitely different.

The Perpetua serifs are a conventional rendering of the old metal type.  
The serifs in your image -- which have a sharp join to the stem rather than a smooth transition -- suggest a relatively recent redesign of Perpetua to give it additional crispness for display purposes. I don't know if this is an actual new font, perhaps under a different name, or a designer's word-smithing.  
Don
